articles.title: Spokesman for CPRK Slams Park Geun Hye's "Address on August 15"
articles.content:
Spokesman for CPRK Slams Park Geun Hye's "Address on August 15"
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued a statement on Sunday lashing out Park Geun Hye for letting loose a spate of invectives against the DPRK in an "address made on August 15."
					 The statement noted:
					
					 Park again let loose a litany of reckless remarks seriously insulting the dignity and social system of the DPRK while talking about "purge", "threat of provocation" and "isolation and destruction", far from repenting of the thrice-cursed crimes of having driven the inter-Korean relations into the worst catastrophe.
					
					 And she impudently behaved as if she were interested in dialogue and cooperation while proposing the building of "a park for peace" in the demilitarized zone, re-linking  of railways and roads, reunion of "divided families" and exchange of sports and culture.
					
					 This is no more than sheer sophism intended to tarnish the international image of the dignified DPRK, pass the buck for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations to it and justify her policy of confrontation on the verge of bankruptcy as it is malignant outbursts of the anti-reunification element hell-bent on the confrontation with the compatriots in the north and sycophancy and treachery.
					
					 As well known to the world, the DPRK put forward landmark proposals and took a series of important measures to bring about a great turn in the inter-Korean relations this year, marking the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					
					 The puppet group, however, staged nuclear war exercises against the north, leaflet scattering operations and kicked up human rights racket and other rows against the DPRK, backed by the U.S. from the outset of this year, deliberately bedeviling the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Recently the puppet regime dampened the aspiration of all Koreans and their efforts to make August 15 an important occasion of north-south reconciliation and national unity by conducting anti-north psychological broadcasting and leaflet scattering operations in the wake of the fabrication of the "mine explosion," a poor farce.
					
					 It announced that it would stage large-scale Ulji Freedom Guardian joint war drills aimed to preempt a nuclear strike at the DPRK together with the U.S. from August 17 quite contrary to "defusing of military tension" and "confidence-building" she mentioned in her address.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that she malignantly hurt the dignity and social system of the DPRK, by talking rubbish about "purge" and "uneasiness of inhabitants" on the auspicious day of liberation. 
					
					 This is an intolerable politically-motivated provocation and a declaration of confrontation and war. Park's above-said utterances are the height of hypocrisy.   
					
					 She should abandon bad blood towards the compatriots in the north and wild ambition to achieve "unification of social systems" before vociferating about what she called for "cooperation." 
					
					 If she stands for "defusing military tension" and "confidence- building," she should not take issue with the north's nuclear deterrent but halt the north-targeted war drills with U.S. nuclear hardware involved as they are the root cause of escalating tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is long since the DPRK has seen through the ulterior motive of Park.
					
					 The puppet regime barely exists through the flow of foreign capital, without having anything of its own. Its talk about "leap" and the like only makes even a cat laugh. 
					
					 Park Geun Hye had better stop her rash acts, clearly mindful that her despicable tongue-lashing would only bring her bitterer shame and final ruin.

articles.title: Enlarged Meeting of  Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Meeting of Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea Held
Pyongyang. August 16 (KCNA) -- An enlarged meeting of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea took place here on Sunday. 
					Present there were Co-Chairpersons Peter Woods and Vu Xuan Hong, co-vice chairpersons and members of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, members of the Joint Secretariat of the committee and its leadership members, delegations and delegates who are taking part in the international solidarity event for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					
					Present there on invitation were So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the Korean Association for Asia-Pacific Exchange, and officials concerned. 
					
					The meeting informed its participants of the committee's activities in the past since its formation and set forth its future action program. 
					
					Peter Woods in a keynote report called for building stronger international public opinion to check and frustrate the U.S. reckless moves for suffocating the DPRK and igniting another Korean war and to ensure durable peace on the peninsula. 
					
					The floor was taken by Fumihiro Himori, co-vice chairman of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea and chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Norma G. Binas, co-general secretary of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea and delegate of the Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula, Peter Wilson, secretary of the New Zealand－DPRK Society, and Phanindra Raj Pant, secretary of the Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea. 
					
					The speakers said that achieving the peace and reunification of Korea is an acute and vital problem directly related to the issue of preserving the peace and security of the world. 
					
					The meeting adopted the action program of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea. 
					
					It elected honorary chairman and members to fill vacancies.

articles.title: Meeting with Participants in International Solidarity Event for Celebrating Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Held
articles.content:
Meeting with Participants in International Solidarity Event for Celebrating Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Held
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- A meeting with the participants in the international solidarity event for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation took place at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Sunday.
					 Present there were a delegation of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association led by Vice-Chairman Khamphanh Sitthidampha, member of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of the People's Supreme Court,  delegation of the Vietnam Union of Friendship Organizations headed by its President Vu Xuan Hong who doubles as co-chairman of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea and Helmi El Hadidi, chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, and other delegations and delegates of friendship and solidarity organizations of different countries and regions and figures of international organizations. They are visiting the DPRK to celebrate the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with the World People, officials concerned, those who experienced and witnessed the human rights abuses of the U.S. and its followers, and experts on human rights issue.
					
					 Jon Ku Gang, lecturer of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, and Rim Chan Ju, a war veteran, bitterly condemned the U.S. imperialists for killing Koreans by the most brutal method including germ warfare that was strictly banned by international law during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Hong Myong Gi, former unconverted long-term prisoner, and Pak Kwang Hyok, student of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, referred to the enemies' brutal tortures, imposition of the ideological conversion and temptation and abduction, saying that south Korea is indeed a veritable hell and worst tundra of human rights and the puppet group are maniacs hell-bent in the confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 Kim Chun Sil, member of the Korean Committee on Measures for the Sexual Slavery for Japanese Army and Drafting Victims, disclosed the true nature of the Japanese authorities' anachronistic acts of evading their responsibility for redressing their past crimes and their hostile policy towards the DPRK, adding that they are embellishing the crimes Japan committed  against humanity and its human, material and spiritual plunder without making any apology and reparation for them, though seven decades have passed since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 Ri Kyong Chol, room chief of the Law Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences, and Mun Ok Hui, head of a department of the Grand People's Study House, bitterly denounced the U.S., the south Korean puppet group and other hostile forces for abusing the genuine human rights of the DPRK and infringing upon the independence and sovereignty after hosting the "office on human rights in north" in south Korea.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori, co-vice chairman of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea and chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Peter Woods, co-chairman of the Asia－Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and Iraklis Tsavdaridis, executive secretary of the World Peace Council, in their speeches expressed their will to raise the voices expressing support and solidarity for the Korean people in their just struggle to achieve the country's reunification and build a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Gifts to Peerlessly Great Persons of Mt. Paektu from Figures of Nigeria, Russia
articles.content:
Gifts to Peerlessly Great Persons of Mt. Paektu from Figures of Nigeria, Russia
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un were presented with gifts by personages of Nigeria and Russia on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Ahmad Rufaisani, senator of Nigeria, presented gifts to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un and the managing director of the Nizhny Novgorod Stroiinvest 3 Co. Ltd., of Russia presented a gift to Kim Jong Un. They were conveyed to DPRK ambassadors to their countries on August 3 and 10.

articles.title: Lebanese Youth Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Lebanese Youth Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic Youth Union of Lebanon headed by Chairman Hassan Zeitouny visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President at the old home in Mangyongdae, the guests looked round the historic relics preserved.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Rungna Dolphinarium, etc.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and overseas compatriots who took part in the international solidarity event for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation and the conference for national reunification for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 They paid tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, they made bows to them.  
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 They made an entry in the visitor's book.
					
					 Khamphanh Sitthidampha, head of a delegation of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, wrote that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were the great leaders who devoted themselves to the happiness of the people and the cause of national reunification.
					
					  Pak Ku Ho, head of a delegation of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, wrote that the feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in strengthening the overseas compatriots movement will remain shining.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Leaves
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation led by Aleksandr Lapin, first vice commander and chief of staff of the Eastern Military District of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, left here for home on Sunday after taking part in the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.

articles.title: U-15 International Football Games to Be Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
U-15 International Football Games to Be Held in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- The Second U-15 International Football Games for Ari Sports Cup will be held in Pyongyang from August 21 to 24.
					 The games will bring together eight football club teams from the DPRK, Brazil, Uzbekistan, China, Croatia and south Korea.
					
					 They will be held at May Day Stadium.

articles.title: Works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Introduced in UK
articles.content:
Works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Introduced in UK
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" and leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" were posted by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on its website on August 8.
					 Kim Il Sung's work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), says that the Korean nation is the driving force for national reunification, and indicates the tasks and ways for achieving the great unity of the whole nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's work, published on August 4, Juche 86 (1997), deals with the immortal exploits performed by the President for national reunification.
					
					 The work formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification and indicates the tasks for accomplishing the cause of national reunification and the ways to do so on the basis of them.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in South Africa, Ecuador
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- There took place seminars and book exhibitions in Nepal, Malaysia and Nigeria from August 3 to 7 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Former prime minister and foreign minister of Nepal Narayan Kaj Shrestha, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), Manik Lama, chairman of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics, and other speakers praised the President for achieving the historic cause of national liberation by leading the arduous anti-Japanese war to victory.
					
					 They said that Korea's liberation was the historic event which instilled strong confidence, hope and encouragement into many colonial countries and progressive people of the world who were fighting for national liberation at that time. 
					
					 Aba Sadik Abubakr, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, and other speakers praised the President who advanced the line of anti-Japanese armed struggle on the principle of Juche idea and Songun idea and founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, defeating the Japanese imperialists and achieving the historic cause of the country's liberation.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at an event held in Nepal.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Different Countries
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars, round-table talks, book and photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Pakistan, India, Myanmar and Ethiopia on August 10 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were books and photos introducing the feats of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Masikryong Ski Resort" and "Songdowon International Children's Camp".
					
					 Zabed Ansari, secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, referred to the noble feats the President performed by leading the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory, achieving the historic cause of national liberation and turning the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 S. P. Pathak, chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il, said that the President embarked on the road of the revolutionary struggle in his teens to liberate the country, defeated the brigandish Japanese imperialists and achieved the cause of the country's liberation.
					
					 The President defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country and built the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence, he noted.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Pakistan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Guinea
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was published in booklet by a publishing house in Guinea.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that holding leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Media Mark Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
Foreign Media Mark Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
Pyongyang, August 16 (KCN) -- Iranian and Nigerian papers carried special write-ups and Guinean broadcasting services aired special programs from August 5 to 10 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea' liberation.
					 The Iranian paper Iran News carried an article illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and a picture of the Arch of Triumph.
					
					 Thanks to the liberation of Korea its people could lead an independent and creative life as masters of their own destiny and the state and society freed from the yoke of colonial slavery of the Japanese imperialists, the article said.
					
					 The reality in the DPRK which is bringing about a fresh leap forward and innovations in the building of a thriving socialist nation makes everybody deeply recollect once again the historic significance of Korea's liberation that provided a turning point in carving out the independent destiny of the people and achieving the prosperity of the country, it noted.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer in an article titled "Korea' liberation, turning point in history" said that the President achieved the historic cause of the country's liberation and founded the Workers' Party of Korea right after the liberation.
					
					 Thanks to the founding of the DPRK on September 9, 1948 it emerged a full-fledged independent and sovereign state in the international arena, it noted, adding:
					
					 Socialism collapsed in various countries at the end of the last century but the red flag of socialism is fluttering more vigorously in the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has become an object of admiration by the international community as it is firmly defending its ideology, social system and cause without any deviation from the road of socialism. 
					
					 Guinean Domestic, International and Seven National Languages Broadcasting Services aired a detailed program on the undying exploits the President performed by liberating the country which once eclipsed on the world map and turning it into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence.
